choral.extraInfo:
Written for The Times Carol Composition Competition 2013
Words by Neil Thompson

choral.title: Before Action
choral.extraInfo: Written for the R A Vestey Trust and St Edmundsbury Cathedral Composition Competition

choral.title: Blessed are all that fear the Lord
choral.extraInfo:
Written for Part II of degree, "Free Composition"
Words: Psalm 128

choral.title: Blessed be that maid Marie
choral.extraInfo:
Written for the Choir & Organ Composition Competition 2012. First performed by St Edmundsbury Cathedral Choir in December 2015 and recorded by them in 2017.
Words: Old English

choral.title: Coldness and Stone
choral.extraInfo: Words by Neil Thompson

choral.title: God of all creation
choral.extraInfo: Written for the RSCM Music Sunday Composition Competition.

choral.title: How beautiful upon the mountains
choral.extraInfo: Written for ATB on Choir Tour in Malaysia; expanded to SATB for GCSE.

choral.title: Hymn Tune: Christ in Glory
choral.extraInfo: Written for Hid within our daily living by Neil Thompson. Never presented, nor performed.

choral.title: Hymn Tune: Christmas with Christ
choral.extraInfo: Words by Neil Thompson.

choral.title: Hymn Tune: Salvation's Song
choral.extraInfo: Written for RSCM Hymn Tune Composition Award 2011.

choral.title: Magnificat and Nunc Dimittis (Fauxbourdons)
choral.extraInfo: Written for the St Edmundsbury Singers. First performed March 2013.

choral.title: Matin Responsory
choral.extraInfo: Written for Lincoln Cathedral Advent Competition 2013. With hints of the traditional Sarum Plainsong.

choral.title: Now the green blade riseth
choral.extraInfo: Written for Katherine Beddus, on her 19th Birthday. Performed three times at Corpus. It's got a good tune, but the third verse and the ending needs a bit of work: there's a bit too much whole-tone/augmented chord experimentation...

choral.title: Omnes amici mei
choral.extraInfo: Written for the Westminster Cathedral Composition Competition

choral.title: Reproaches
choral.extraInfo: Written at a time when it looked like only three singers would be allowed on Good Friday. Also available: a Tablet edition with it fully written out.

choral.title: Requiem Aeternam
choral.extraInfo: Simple harmonised arrangement of Mode VI, as in NEH. Performed at a few funerals at Corpus.

choral.title: Saepe Expugnaverunt
choral.extraInfo: A setting (in English) of Psalm 129. Part of a set of three, including "Blessed are all that fear the Lord". This setting is loosely based on a Plainsong Psalm tone, with a fair amount of whole-tone harmony.

choral.title: The First Nowell
choral.extraInfo: Written for the Leeds Philharmonic Christmas Carol Competition (commended).

choral.title: The Good Friday Passion
choral.extraInfo: Written for Rochester Cathedral Choir and performed there annually on Good Friday from 2011 to 2019. This setting uses the traditional plainsong with the usual chorus parts set to new music. Additionally, the part of God and parts of the Evangelist are taken by the choir. Inspiration from the Camidge chant as often used for Psalm 22 (as set for Good Friday). The original version only set chapter 19, but chapter 18 has now been prepended.

choral.title: The Good Shepherd
choral.extraInfo: Winner of the Durham Cathedral Composition Competition.

choral.title: Thou hast been a strength to the poor
choral.extraInfo: Written for the Canterbury Cathedral Palimpsest Composition Competition.

choral.title: Veni Sancte Spiritus
choral.extraInfo: Written for St Edmundsbury Cathedral Choir, for use during the Ordination of Priests. It is based on the traditional plainsong, and is designed to be flexible in length: it was sung during the Ordination Prayer, from a distance.

choral.title: Victimae Paschali Laudes
choral.extraInfo: Written for the St Edmundsbury Singers, this is based on the traditional Easter plainsong.

choral.title: What does the Lord thy God require
choral.extraInfo: Written for the King James Bible Trust Composition Competition.

choral.title: When the Lord comes
choral.extraInfo: Written for the Girls' Choir at Rochester Cathedral. Was one of the four introits sung at the start of the Eucharist whilst the Advent Candle was lit. This is for Advent 3. I reduced the number of parts in 2011.

other.title: Short Fanfare on Victimae Paschali Laudes
